page.title: 01A Review of the Butley Area.
page.content: utley is a very rural place with a small population. All the land is less than one hundred feet obove sea level and was therefore prone to flooding. Much sea defence work has been done to prevent this. The main road is the B1084 which runs from Woodbridge to Orford. There are also minor roads leading to Tunstall, Hollesley and Bentwaters Air Base, a large American Air Force establishment which has a great effect on this rural area. The small stream known as Butley River is fresh water, but becomes tidal, with reed beds or saltmarshes either side of the river. Sir Edward Greenwell owns most of the farms and the fields around Butley. Neighbouring villages, Chillesford, Capel and Wantisden are also small.
